:	O

BACKGROUND	O
:	O
The	O
septo	O
-	O
hippocampal	O
cholinergic	O
pathway	O
has	O
been	O
implicated	O
in	O
epileptogenesis	O
,	O
and	O
genetic	O
factors	O
influence	O
the	O
response	O
to	O
cholinergic	O
agents	O
,	O
but	O
limited	O
data	O
are	O
available	O
on	O
cholinergic	O
involvement	O
in	O
alcohol	B-Chemical
withdrawal	T-compound
severity	T-compound
.	O

Thus	O
,	O
the	O
relationship	O
between	O
cholinergic	O
activity	O
and	O
responsiveness	T-compound
and	T-compound
alcohol	B-Chemical
withdrawal	T-compound
was	O
investigated	O
in	O
a	O
genetic	O
animal	O
model	O
of	O
ethanol	O
withdrawal	O
severity	O
.	O

Thus	O
,	O
the	O
relationship	O

DISCUSSION	O
:	O
The	O
risk	O
of	O
rhabdomyolysis	O
is	O
increased	O
in	O
the	O
presence	O
of	O
concomitant	O
drugs	O
that	O
inhibit	T-compound
simvastatin	B-Chemical
metabolism	T-compound
.	O

Simvastatin	B-Chemical
is	T-nsubj:pass
metabolized	T-nsubj:pass
by	O
CYP3A4	T-nsubj:pass
.	O

Amiodarone	B-Chemical
and	T-conj
atazanavir	T-conj
are	T-nsubj:pass
recognized	T-nsubj:pass
CYP3A4	O
inhibitors	T-nsubj:pass
.	O

Amiodarone	T-conj
and	T-cc
atazanavir	B-Chemical
are	O
recognized	T-conj
CYP3A4	O
inhibitors	O
.	O

CONCLUSIONS	O
:	O
Pharmacokinetic	T-nmod
differences	T-nmod
in	T-case
statins	B-Chemical
are	O
an	O
important	O
consideration	T-nmod
for	O
assessing	O
the	O
risk	O
of	O
potential	O
drug	O
interactions	O
.	O

In	O
patients	O
requiring	T-nmod
the	T-nmod
concurrent	T-nmod
use	T-nmod
of	T-case
statins	B-Chemical
and	T-conj
CYP3A4	T-conj
inhibitors	T-conj
,	O
pravastatin	T-conj
,	O
fluvastatin	T-conj
,	O
and	T-conj
rosuvastatin	T-conj
carry	O
the	O
lowest	O
risk	O
of	O
drug	O
interactions	O
;	O
atorvastatin	O
carries	O
moderate	O
risk	O
,	O
whereas	O
simvastatin	O
and	O
lovastatin	O
have	O
the	O
highest	O
risk	O
and	O
should	O
be	O
avoided	O
in	O
patients	O
taking	O
concomitant	O
CYP3A4	O
inhibitors	O
.	O
